gurmukhi: ਹਰੜੰਤ ਹੱਥ ਖਰੜੰਤ ਖੋਲ || ਟਿਰੜੰਤ ਟੀਕ ਝਿਰੜੰਤ ਝੋਲ || ਦਰੜੰਤ ਦੀਹ ਦਾਨੋ ਦੁਰੰਤ || ਹਰੜੰਤ ਹਾਸ ਹੱਸਤ ਮਹੰਤ ||੫੨੦||
transliteration: Har-dant Hatth Khar- Dant Khol|| Teer-dant  Teek Shherdant Dhol|| Dar- Dant Deeh Daano Durant|| Har- Dant Haas Hassat Mahant||520||
translation: The knocking sound of the sheaths and the clattering of swords is being heard; the terrible demons are being crushed and the ganas and others are laughing loudly.520.

gurmukhi: ਰਹਾ ਸੰਕਪਾਲੰ || ਸੁਬਾਸੰ ਛਤਾਲੰ || ਪ੍ਰਭਾਸੰ ਜੁਵਾਲੰ || ਅਨਾਮੰ ਕਰਾਲੰ ||੫੨੧||
transliteration: Rahaa Sankpaalan|| Soubaasan Chhataalan|| Prabhaasan Juvaalan|| Anaamannd Karaalan||521||
translation: The Kalki incarnation like Shiva, giver of happiness to all, mounting on his Bull, remained stable in the battlefield like the dreadful fires.521.

gurmukhi: ਮਹਾ ਰੂਪ ਧਾਰੇ || ਦੁਰੰ ਦੁਖ ਤਾਰੇ || ਸ਼ਰਣੀ ੳੁਧਾਰੇ || ਅਘੀ ਪਾਪ ਟਾਰੇ ||੫੨੨||
transliteration: Mahaa Roop Dhdare|| Duran Doukh Tdare|| Sharni Udhdare|| Aghipaap Tdare||522||
translation: He, assuming his great benign form, was destroying the afflicting agonies; he was redeeming those who had taken shelter and was removing th effect of sin of the sinners.522.

gurmukhi: ਦਿਪੈ ਜੋਤ ਜ੍ਵਾਲਾ || ਕਿਧੌ ਜ੍ਵਾਲ ਮਾਲਾ || ਮਨੋ ਜ੍ਵਾਲ ਅਾਲਾ || ਸਰੂਪੰ ਕਰਾਲਾ ||੫੨੩||
transliteration: Dipai Jot Jvaalaa|| Kidhau Jvaal Maalaa|| Mano Jvaal Aalaa|| Daroopan Karaalaa||523||
translation: He was unfolding brilliance like the fire or the roasary of fire; his dreadful form was radiating brightness like fire.523.

gurmukhi: ਧਰੇ ਖੱਗ ਪਾਣੰ || ਤਿਹੂੰ ਲੋਕ ਮਾਣੰ || ਦਯੰ ਦੀਹ ਦਾਨੰ || ਭਰੇ ਮੳੁਜ ਮਾਨੰ ||੫੨੪||
transliteration: Ddare Khagg Paanan|| Tihoon Lok Maanan|| Dayan Dih Daanan|| Bhare Mauj Maanan||524||
translation: The Lord of all the three worlds took his dagger in his hand and in his pleasure, he destroyed the demons.524.

gurmukhi: ਅਜੀਤੇ ਜੀਤ ਜੀਤ ਕੈ || ਅਭੀਰੀ ਭਾਜੇ ਭੀਰ ਹ੍ਵੈ || ਸਿਧਾਰੇ ਚੀਨ ਰਾਜ ਪੈ || ਸਥੋੲੀ ਸਰਬ ਸਾਥ ਕੈ ||੫੨੫||
transliteration: Ajeete Jeet Jeet Kai|| Abheeribhaaje Bheer Hvai|| Sidhdare Cheen Raaj Pai|| Sathoisarab Saath Kai||525||
translation: Conquering the invincible people and causing the warriors to run away like cowards and taking all his allies with him, he reached the kingdom of China.525.

gurmukhi: ਤਮੰਕੇ ਰਾਜ ਧਾਰੀ ਕੈ || ਰਜੀਲੇ ਰੋਹਵਾਰੀ ਕੈ || ਕਟੀਲੇ ਕਾਮ ਰੂਪਾ ਕੇ || ਕੰਬੋਜ ਕਾਸ ਕਾਰੀ ਕੇ ||੫੨੬||
transliteration: Tamannde Raaj Dhaarikai|| Rajeele Rohvaarikai|| Kateele Kaam Roopaa Ke|| Kanboj Kaas Kaarike||526||
translation: The angry and furious tone of the Kalki incarnation, who assumed royalty, is very queer; before him, the beauty of the women of Kamroop with bewitching eyes and the charm of Kamboj country is devoid of radiance.526.

gurmukhi: ਢਮੰਕੇ ਢੋਲ ਢਾਲੋ ਕੇ || ਡਮੰਕੇ ਡੰਕ ਵਾਰੋ ਕੇ || ਘੱਮੰਕੇ ਨੇਕੇ ਬਾਜਾ ਦੇ || ਤਮੰਕੇ ਤੀਰ ਤਾਜਾ ਦੇ ||੫੨੭||
transliteration: Dhamannke Dhol Dhaalo Ke|| Damannke Dank Varo Ke|| Ghammanke Neke Baajaa De|| Tamannde Teer Taajaa Ke||527||
translation: His drums, are his shields, his blows are severe, his musical instruments create loud sounds and his arrows raise anger and ire.527.

gurmukhi: ਜੀਤੇ ਅਜੀਤ ਮੰਡੇ ਅਮੰਡ || ਤੋਰੇ ਅਤੋਰ ਖੰਡੇ ਅਖੰਡ || ਭੰਨੇ ਅਭੰਨ ਭੱਜੇ ਅਭੱਜਿ || ਖਾਨੇ ਖਵਾਸ ਮਾਵਾਸ ਤੱਜਿ ||੫੨੮||
transliteration: Jeete Ajeet Mande Amannd|| Tore Ator Khande Akhannd|| Bhanne Abhann Bhajje Abhajj(i)|| Khaane Khavaas Maavaas Tajj(i)||528||
translation: He conquered the unconquerable, established the unestablished; He broke the unbreakable and devided the indivisible; He broke the unbreakable and he destroyed those who resisted.528.

gurmukhi: ਸੰਕੜੇ ਸੂਰ ਭੰਭਰੇ ਭੀਰ || ਨਿਰਖੰਤ ਜੋਧ ਰੀਝੰਤ ਹੂਰ || ਡਾਰੰਤ ਸੀਸ ਕੇਸਰ ਕਟੋਰ || ਮ੍ਰਗਦਸ ਗੁਲਾਬ ਕਰਪੂਰ ਘੋਰ ||੫੨੯||
transliteration: Sankade Soor Bhanbhare Bheer|| Nirkhanndjodh Reejhant Hoor|| Daarant Sees Kesar Kator || Mrigdam Gulaab Karpoor Ghor||529
translation: The heavenly damsels, seeing both the brave and coward warriors were getting pleased; they were all sprinkling roses, camphor nad saffron on the head of kalki incarnation.529.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਹ ਭਾਂਤ ਜੀਤ ਤੀਨੰ ਦਿਸਾਣ || ਬੱਜਿਓ ਸੁ ਕੋਪ ੳੁੱਤਰ ਨਿਸ਼ਾਣ || ਚੱਲੇ ਸੁ ਚੀਨ ਮਾਚੀਨ ਦੇਸ || ਸਾਮੰਤ ਸੁੱਧ ਰਾਵਲੀ ਭੇਖ ||੫੩੦||
transliteration: Eh Bhaant Jeet Teenan Disaan|| Bajjio Su Kop Outtar Nishaan|| Challe Su Cheen Maacheen Des|| Saamannd Suddh Raavalibhekh||530||
translation: In this way, after conquering the three directions the trumpet sounded in the North; he went towards China and Manchuria, where there were people in the garb of Rawalpanthis.530.
